questions.question: Local beam search with k = 1 is an example of?

explanations.b: Local beam search with k = 1 is an example of Local Hill Climbing.

questions.question: What is the primary advantage of local beam search?

answers.a: It can explore multiple paths simultaneously
answers.b: It is always guaranteed to find the optimal solution
answers.c: It ensures exhaustive exploration of the search space

explanations.a: Local beam search can explore multiple paths simultaneously because of the beam width

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true about Local Beam Search? \ Statement 1: Local Beam Search explores a single path at a time. \ Statement 2: Local Beam Search is a memory-intensive search algorithm.

explanations.d: Local Beam Search explores multiple paths simultaneously and is not memory-intensive.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes local beam search?

answers.a: A search algorithm that expands all possible paths simultaneously
answers.b: A search algorithm that focuses on a single path at a time
answers.c: A search algorithm that selects multiple paths to explore in parallel

explanations.c: Local beam search selects multiple paths to explore in parallel, with the hope that one of them will lead to the goal.

questions.question: In beam search, the beam width determines

answers.a: The maximum depth of the search tree
answers.b: The probability of selecting a given path for exploration.
answers.d: The number of paths selected for exploration at each iteration

explanations.d: The beam width determines the number of paths selected for exploration at each iteration.

questions.question: What is a potential drawback of using a narrow beam width in beam search?

answers.c: Limited exploration of the search space

explanations.c: With a narrow beam width, the search may not explore a wide enough range of paths, potentially missing the optimal solution.
